thread.title: Lions still looking for first win of season

title: Lions still looking for first win of season

Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs 13 On Your Sidelines: Vote for the Week 6 Mercy Health MVP Vote now for the 13 OYSL Week 6 MVP Eric D Lloyd, 7:58 p.m. EDT October 5, 2015 Football 32 CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
(WZZM) -- We have several teams locked into the playoffs already and a few dozen just knocking on the door over the next few weeks, but we are here to pick the best individual performances in West Michigan. 
Our Week 6 Mercy Health On Your Sidelines MVP nominees are: 
Tyler Lamica - R unning Back/Linebacker, Grand Rapids Christian The Eagles fought back from a 26-0 hole against East Grand Rapids in big part because of Lamica. The short yardage back punched in three touchdowns at the goal line, but added twenty tackles on defense from the linebacker spot. Christian won 39-33 in overtime. 
Max Dean - Running Back, Lowell The Arrows ran away from Caledonia 42-7 and Dean did most of the running. He put up 206 yards and two touchdowns on an offense that has yet to score less than 35 points in a game this year. 
Josh Saltzgaber - Running Back, Byron Center The Saltzgaber boys pushed the Bulldogs past Holland Christian 33-28 but it was Josh that put up the big numbers. 161 yards on the ground, three rushing touchdowns and 12 tackles on defense. 
Two OK White rivals and a superstar from the green, who will be this week's MVP? That's up to you. 
Voting is underway until 10 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 8. The winner will be announced Friday night on 13 On Your Sidelines.
